### Prerequisites

- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

```PowerShell
PS > $PSStyle.Progress.MaxWidth = 0
```

### Expected behavior

As the documentation says:

> `$PSStyle.Progress.MaxWidth` - Sets the max width of the view. **Set to 0 for console width.** Defaults to 120


### Actual behavior

Causes an error:

*SetValueInvocationException: Exception setting "MaxWidth": "The MaxWidth for the Progress rendering must be at least 18 to render correctly. (Parameter 'MaxWidth')"*


### Error details

_No response_

comments.author: FireInWinter
comments.body: I hope it is supposed to be able to be set to 0 for console width.  Otherwise it will be sort of a pain to set it to a decent size as the default of 120 is really small when you have a really wide monitor.  You could probably set it to the max width by getting the window size from $host, but then you have to make sure you change it if the window size changes.

title: `$PSStyle.Progress.MaxWidth` doesn't allow 0
